page.title: 14Highland Gathering, Corby.
page.content: Corby is one of the few places outside Scotland that has an annual gathering of the clans. Due to the large number of Scots in the population and the many family links a traditional Highland Gathering became a popular annual event in the 1970's and has continued since. It is held over one week-end, usually in July at the Welfare Ground, the original recreational ground built for the steelworkers. The first day of the event has Scottish dancing and pipe band championships during the day and in the afternoon there are traditional athletics events, such as tossing the caber and throwing the hammer. These are both well attended by national and international teams. Several years ago the World Pipe Band Championship was hosted. The Sunday is a fun day, with displays, competitions and a funfair.
